templates.name: Architecture Decision
templates.description: Template for architectural and technical design decisions

fields.title: Required: Brief decision title
fields.rationale: Required: Why this decision was made
fields.participants: Required: Who was involved in the decision
fields.reviewDate: Optional: When to review this decision again

example.title: Switch from REST to GraphQL for new APIs
example.description: All new APIs will use GraphQL instead of REST. Existing REST APIs will remain but won't be expanded.
example.rationale: GraphQL provides better flexibility for frontend, reduces over-fetching, enables better documentation through introspection, and allows clients to request exactly what they need.
alternatives: Continue with REST (rejected due to over-fetching issues)
Use gRPC (rejected due to web browser compatibility)
Hybrid REST + GraphQL (rejected due to increased complexity)
consequences: Negative: Team needs to learn GraphQL
Negative: Additional infrastructure for GraphQL server

fields.title: Required: Technical decision summary
fields.rationale: Required: Why this choice was made

example.title: Use PostgreSQL for CRM data storage
example.description: CRM data (clients, practices, interactions) will be stored in PostgreSQL instead of a separate microservice or NoSQL database.
example.rationale: PostgreSQL provides ACID transactions needed for CRM data integrity, has excellent JSON support for flexible fields, integrates well with existing infrastructure, and the team has strong expertise.
alternatives: MongoDB - rejected due to lack of ACID transactions
Separate microservice - rejected due to added complexity
Firestore - rejected due to cost at scale

templates.name: Business Decision
templates.description: Template for business strategy and operations decisions

fields.title: Required: Business decision summary
fields.metrics: Optional: How success will be measured

example.title: Launch Google Workspace integration as premium feature
example.description: Google Workspace integration (Gmail, Drive, Calendar, Sheets) will be available only for premium plan customers, not free tier.
example.rationale: Integration has significant development and maintenance cost, premium positioning aligns with target market (businesses), creates clear upgrade incentive.
example.expectedOutcome: 15-20% increase in premium conversions, higher customer lifetime value

templates.name: Hiring Decision
templates.description: Template for hiring and team expansion decisions

fields.title: Required: Candidate name and role
fields.rationale: Required: Why this candidate was chosen

example.title: Hired Anna Rossi as Frontend Developer
example.description: Anna Rossi accepted offer for Frontend Developer position. Salary: $75k/year, start date: 2024-12-01.
example.rationale: Strong technical skills in React and TypeScript, excellent portfolio, culture fit confirmed by team interviews, previous experience with similar projects.
example.interviewFeedback: Marco: 4/5 (strong technical), Sara: 5/5 (excellent culture fit), Zero: 4/5 (good problem solving)

templates.name: Process Decision
templates.description: Template for workflow and process decisions

fields.title: Required: Process change summary
fields.rationale: Required: Why this change is needed

example.title: Implement 2-person code review requirement
example.description: All PRs must have approval from 2 team members before merging to main (previously only 1).
example.rationale: Recent production bugs could have been caught with additional review. Higher quality bar needed as codebase grows and customer base increases.
example.newProcess: 2 approvals required. At least one must be from senior developer. Exception: hotfixes can use 1 approval with post-merge review.
example.rolloutPlan: Update GitHub branch protection rules immediately. Communicate in team meeting. Monitor review times for bottlenecks.

fields.title: Required: Security decision summary
fields.description: Required: What security measure was decided
fields.rationale: Required: Security reasoning and threat addressed
fields.riskLevel: Required: Risk level if not implemented

example.title: Require 2FA for all production deployments
example.description: All users with production deployment access must enable 2FA. Deployment tools will verify 2FA is active before allowing production deploys.
example.rationale: Production access is high-risk. Single-factor authentication insufficient given increasing security threats. 2FA significantly reduces risk of unauthorized deployments.
example.complianceRequirement: Aligns with SOC 2 requirements for production access controls

templates.name: Incident Decision
templates.description: Template for incident response and resolution decisions

fields.title: Required: Incident summary
fields.description: Required: What happened and what was decided
fields.affectedUsers: Optional: Number or percentage of users affected

example.title: Memory leak causing backend crashes - deployed emergency fix
example.description: Backend v2.3.4 had memory leak in ChromaDB connection pool causing crashes every 2-3 hours. Decided to deploy emergency fix (v2.3.5) outside normal release cycle.
example.rootCause: ChromaDB connections not properly closed in error handling paths. Connection pool exhausted over time leading to OOM crashes.
example.resolution: Added proper connection cleanup in all error handlers. Deployed v2.3.5 with fix. Restarted all backend instances.
example.preventionMeasures: Add connection monitoring alerts, implement connection leak detector in tests, mandate connection pooling review in code reviews for database code.

usage_notes: Select the template that best matches your decision type
Fill all required fields - they are marked as Required in the template
Optional fields provide additional context and should be used when relevant
Tags help categorize and search decisions later
Review dates are important for decisions that may need revisiting
Use clear, concise language - future team members will read this
Include specific details (versions, dates, metrics) not just general descriptions
best_practices: Log decisions as soon as they are made, not days later
Include dissenting opinions in rationale when applicable
Link to related documents (PRs, design docs, metrics dashboards)
Update decision status when implemented or reversed
Review critical decisions quarterly to ensure they still make sense
Make decisions searchable by using consistent tags
Include everyone who was involved in the decision
Be honest about alternatives and tradeoffs
